header: What is the difference between Element and Component?
content:
An Element is a plain object describing what you want to appear on the screen in terms of the DOM nodes or other components. Elements can contain other Elements in their props. Creating a React element is cheap.

Whereas a Component can be declared in several different ways. It can be a class with a render() method. Alternatively, in simple cases, it can be defined as a function. In either case, it takes props as an input, and returns a JSX tree as the output.

header: Why should we not update the state directly?
content: If you try to update state directly then it won't re-render the component. Instead use setState() method, it schedules an update to a component's state object. When state changes, the component responds by re-rendering.
